newsitem.title: USA: Indiana corn, soy harvest advances but lags 1995.
newsitem.headline: Indiana corn, soy harvest advances but lags 1995.

text.p: Indiana's corn and soybean harvest advanced during the week ended Sunday, but corn harvest was 14 days behind the average and soybeans 15 days behind, said the state's Agricultural Statistics Service.
Corn was 47 percent harvested versus 92 a year ago and the 72 average. Average moisture content of harvested corn remained at 24 percent.
Strong winds about mid-week increased lodging problems in corn.
Soybeans were 80 percent harvested versus 99 a year ago and the 95 average. Average moisture remained at 13 percent.
Winter wheat was 70 percent emerged and 88 planted, versus 80 and 97 a year ago, and the averages of 78 and 94. The wheat was rated 70 percent good to excellent versus 50 a year ago.
Topsoil moisture was rated eight percent surplus, 87 adequate and five average. Subsoil moisture was rated five percent surplus, 79 adequate, 15 short and one very short.
There were five days suitable for fieldwork.
